result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin J Vanegeren was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to any other sentence and consecutive to each other.  If probation is revoked, the defendant is to receive credit for 18 days.

miscConds.notes: Any cash bond on file will be first applied to the court appointed attorney fees and the balance to the court costs.  CASH BOND OF $250.00 APPLIED.

1.  Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
2.  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
3.  Defendant is to re-pay the costs for Court Appointed Attorney.  Any cash bond on file will be first applied to the court appointed attorney fees and the balance to the court costs.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant has not been discharged and Notice of Case Status Change filed January 12, 2017, was filed in error.  Defendant's Probation is extended to December 23, 2017, and paperwork is still being processed with DOC per phone call with Agent Stockwell.
Terminated - Regular, effective December 23, 2016
Petition and Stipulation to Waive Appearance and Order Extending Probation for Unpaid Court Obligations - 1 year, New Discharge Date December 23, 2017

1:01 pm
Defendant Kevin J Vanegeren in custody and without counsel.  Agent Kari Stockwell in court.
Agent makes statement that Defendant has made some payments.
Court finds the Defendant has not made a good faith effort and extends probation for 1 year.
Court informs the Defendant that, if not paid, the Court will fashion conditions to include jail time.
Court instructs the Defendant regarding right to and how to obtain counsel.
Court adjourned at 1:05 pm

9:04 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jim Peebles.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Peebles - has an agreement.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to Battery in 2014CM146 and BJ in 2015CM7, 2014CM189 will be dismissed and read-in.  State concurs.  Atty Peebles concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count 1 in 2014CM146 and count 1 on 2015CM7.  Court orders 2014CM189 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Peebles.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2014CM146 - 60 days county jail, consecutive to any other sentence and consecutive to each other, stayed and places the defendant on probation for 18 months concurrent to 2015CM7.

2015CM7 - 60 days county jail, consecutive to any other sentence and consecutive to each other, stayed and places the defendant on probation for 18 months concurrent to 2014CM146.

CONDITIONS:

Court costs.
Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Defendant is to pay Court appointed attorney fees.

Atty Peebles to submit a bill for court appointed attorney fees.

Any cash bond on file will be first applied to the court appointed attorney fees and the balance to the court costs.

2015CM7 - 18 days of sentence credit.

Court adjourned at 9:15 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 06-23-2015 09:00 am

1:40 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty James Peebles.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Peebles - requests a plea & sentencing be scheduled.  Court sets for Plea & sentencing on June 23, 2015 at 9:00 a.m.   Court addresses Court appointed Attorney fees.  Statement by defendant.

Court adjourned at 1:42 p.m.
to Atty Jim Peebles with copy of the criminal complaint, minutes and bail bond

to the defendant - Request for court appointed counsel has been approved.  Court appoints Atty James Peebles to represent.  Defendant is to pay $75.00 per week commencing April 10, 2015 and every month thereafter.
and Order - approved

1:08 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail and without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court questions defendant regarding residence and employment.  Court sets bond at $250.00 cash bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Court will set for Status Hearing on January 26, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 1:11 p.m.
